name: bloom_level
description: Specifies the highest level of Bloom's Taxonomy that the educational content is designed to achieve. This classification helps in identifying the cognitive complexity intended for the learner.

name: diversity_attention
description: It is used to indicate the availability of specific features or adaptations within an educational resource that make it accessible and usable by people with special needs or difficulties.

name: key_competence
description:
Key competences of the LOMLOE associated with the content. The 8 key competencies of the LOMLOE are:

1. Competence in linguistic communication (ccl).
2. Multilingual competence (cp).
3. Mathematical competence and competence in science, technology and engineering (stem).
4. Digital competence (cd)
5. Personal, social and learning to learn (PSLL) competency.
6. Citizenship competence (cc)
7. Entrepreneurial competence (ce)
8. Competence in cultural awareness and expression (ccec).

name: location
description: Typical locations where it is possible to work with the referenced material or are optimal for carrying out the activity.

name: modality
description: Specifies the delivery method or learning environment of a course, educational program, workshop, or any other type of formative content.

name: semantic_density
description: Evaluates the amount of educational information contained in the learning object in relation to its size or duration. An object can have a high semantic density if it contains a lot of information in a condensed format.

name: difficulty
description: Evaluates the level of difficulty of the learning object, from very easy to very difficult, based on the target user's ability to understand and use the learning object.

name: disability
description: Describes the type of disability or problem that the resource addresses and for which the resource is adapted.

name: interactivity level
description: Measures the extent to which the user can interact with the learning object. It varies from very low to very high, indicating the extent of possible interaction (for example, navigation, progress control, response entry).

name: outdate_probability
description: Estimation of the risk that the content of a learning object becomes obsolete or loses relevance over time.

name: cognitive_process
description: Refers to a category that encompasses the tasks, skills, and mental actions involved in learning and knowledge acquisition, which are used in information processing, problem-solving, and knowledge generation.

name: access_type
description:
A distinction is made between:

- universal: when access to the content is unrestricted, and therefore, it is open to any network user regardless of its provenance or characteristics.
- non-universal: when access to the content has some kind of restriction, either by origin or by other characteristics.

name: intelligence
description: Identifies the particular focus of cognitive development that the educational content addresses (following H. Gardner)., Identifies the particular approach to cognitive development that the educational content addresses according to Howard Gardner's multiple intelligences. These labels classify specific areas of cognitive skills and abilities, recognizing the diversity in the way people learn and understand the world.

name: interactivity_type
description:
The predominant type of learning supported by this educational object:

- Active learning (i.e., participatory learning) is that supported by those contents that induce direct participation on the part of the learners. An active learning object asks the learner to interact and introduce semantically meaningful information, make decisions or perform some kind of productive activity. All of this is not necessarily in the context of the educational object itself. Active objects include simulators, quizzes and exercises.
- Expository learning (i.e. passive learning) is learning in which the learner's main task is to assimilate the concepts that are presented to him or her (usually by means of text, images or sounds). An expository learning object displays information to the learner without requesting any semantically meaningful action on the part of the learner. Expository objects include essays, videos, all kinds of graphic material and hypertext documents.
hypertextual documents.
- When an educational object mixes the active and expository types, then its level of interactivity will be blended.

NOTE 1: the activation of links to navigate in hypertext documents is not considered as productive or semantically meaningful actions.

name: resource_type
description:
Describes the pedagogical function of the learning object, such as exercise, experiment, simulation, quiz, diagram, figure, graph, etc. This element helps to identify the nature of the resource and its potential use in the learning process., The specific type of educational resource or digital object (ODE). In order to facilitate the identification of the type of resource, the vocabulary values have been organized into 5 groups that are differentiated from each other according to structural complexity and the appearance or not of explicit didactic functionality (instructional design), which appears only in the group Didactic content. The predominant type or value should appear first. Some vocabulary terms come from the original LOM v.1.0 vocabulary (defined from OED: 1989 and its practical use in educational communities). As described in category 1, the type of object would be related to the level of aggregation and the approximate curricular coverage (element 1.8 and category 9, purpose discipline and educational level respectively).

name: tone
description: Communicative attitude of the content.

name: sdg
description: Specifies the link between educational content and the Sustainable Development Goals set by the United Nations to promote awareness and education in sustainability.

name: pedagogical_methodology
description: Classify content according to the pedagogical methodology that best fits or that is used in its development., Classifies content according to the pedagogical methodology that best fits or that is used in its development.

name: 21st_century_skills
description: Classifies content according to the key competencies for the 21st century that it promotes.

name: collaboration_and_teamwork
description: Indicates if the resource is designed to be used in collaborative activities or teamwork.

name: critical_thinking
description: Indicates if the content is designed to foster critical thinking among students.

name: cross-cutting element
description: They encompass concepts, values or skills that transcend the traditional boundaries of academic disciplines. These labels allow the identification of thematic areas that are naturally integrated into multiple areas of the school curriculum, promoting a more holistic and comprehensive education.

name: addressee
description:
The main user(s) for whom this educational object has been designed. In order to facilitate the identification of the target of the object during the labeling process, the vocabulary has been organized according to 4 factors:

- Type of learner: it collects the values corresponding to the different types of learners to whom an ODE can be addressed

name: grouping
description: Groups the values that provide information on how the recipients should be organized during the use of the object.

name: educator
description: Includes the values corresponding to the types of educational agents to whom an ODE can also be destined when participating in the teaching-learning process as facilitators and co-responsible.

name: experts
description: Includes the values corresponding to the types of managers and/or experts for whom a digital object may also be intended.

name: assistance
description: The type of assistance or support needed for the correct use of the object, if any.
